evidence.title: NIST SP 800-82 Rev.3 Industrial Control Systems Guide
evidence.snippet: Edge devices that backhaul to cloud providers must enforce zero-trust segmentation, signed firmware updates, and supply-chain vetting before being placed on municipal fiber.

evidence.title: MS-ISAC Camera Hardening Advisory
evidence.snippet: Shared credentials and unmanaged firmware remain the primary vector for lateral movement from smart lighting or camera platforms into OT networks.

risks.description: The brief references an unknown vendor for ALPR/video endpoints without outlining firmware management or supply-chain checks; compromised devices could pivot into campus ITS infrastructure.
risks.mitigation: Require SBOM review, signed firmware policies, and placement behind a segmented OT gateway before onboarding any sensors.

risks.description: Cloud storage is selected but no detail is provided on how credentials or API tokens will be rotated, increasing exposure to credential stuffing against the upload endpoints.
risks.mitigation: Implement hardware-backed secrets for sensor gateways and enforce short-lived OAuth tokens for the cloud ingest path.

requirements.description: Perform a vendor security assessment (firmware signing, SBOM, SOC 2) before approving equipment for Glades Rd or campus-core deployments.
Deploy network segmentation and certificate-based authentication for every sensor backhaul tunnel.

notes: OT engineering recommends HOLD because the vendor supply chain and network segmentation controls are undefined for Scenario A.
